de.mrapp.android.util

Class AppUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.AppUtil

  • public final class AppUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides static methods, which allow to start system apps.
    Since:
    1.3.0

    • Method Detail

      • startCameraApp

        public static void startCameraApp(@NonNull
                                  android.app.Activity activity,
                                  int requestCode,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.io.File file)
        Starts the camera app in order to capture a picture. If an error occurs while starting the camera app, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the captured picture should be passed to by calling its onActivityResult method, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        requestCode - The request code, which should be used to pass the captured picture to the given activity, as an Integer value
        file - The file, the captured picture should be saved to, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null. The file must exist and must not be a directory.

      • startCameraApp

        public static void startCameraApp(@NonNull
                                  android.app.Activity activity,
                                  int requestCode,
                                  @NonNull
                                  android.net.Uri uri)
        Starts the camera app in order to capture a picture. If an error occurs while starting the camera app, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the captured picture should be passed to by calling its onActivityResult method, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        requestCode - The request code, which should be used to pass the captured picture to the given activity, as an Integer value
        uri - The URI of the file, the captured image should be saved to, as an instance of the class Uri. The URI may not be null

      • startGalleryApp

        public static void startGalleryApp(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   int requestCode)
        Starts the gallery app in order to choose a picture. In an error occurs while starting the gallery app, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the chosen image should be passed to by calling its onActivityResult method, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        requestCode - The request code, which should be used to pass the captured picture to the given activity, as an Integer value

      • startGalleryApp

        public static void startGalleryApp(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   @NonNull
                                   java.io.File file)
        Starts the gallery app in order to show a specific image. If an error occurs while starting the gallery app, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the gallery app should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        file - The file, which stores the image, which should be shown, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null. The file must exist and must not be a directory.

      • startGalleryApp

        public static void startGalleryApp(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   @NonNull
                                   android.net.Uri uri)
        Starts the gallery app in order to show a specific image. If an error occurs while starting the gallery app, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the gallery app should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        uri - The URI of the image, which should be shown, as an instance of the class Uri. The URI may not be null and must be valid

      • startWebBrowser

        public static void startWebBrowser(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   @NonNull
                                   java.lang.String uri)
        Starts the web browser in order to show a specific URI. If an error occurs while starting the web browser an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the web browser should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        uri - The URI, which should be shown, as a String. The URI may neither be null, nor empty

      • startWebBrowser

        public static void startWebBrowser(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   @NonNull
                                   android.net.Uri uri)
        Starts the web browser in order to show a specific URI. If an error occurs while starting the web browser an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the web browser should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        uri - The URI, which should be shown, as an instance of the class Uri. The URI may not be null

      • startMailClient

        public static void startMailClient(@NonNull
                                   android.app.Activity activity,
                                   @NonNull
                                   java.lang.String emailAddress)
        Starts the mail client in order to send an e-mail to a specific e-mail address. If an error occurs while starting the mail client, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the mail client should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        emailAddress - The e-mail address, the e-mail should be sent to, as a String. The e-mail address may neither be null, nor empty

      • startDialer

        public static void startDialer(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               int phoneNumber)
        Starts the dialer in order to call a specific phone number. If an error occurs while starting the dialer, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the dialer should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        phoneNumber - The phone number, which should be called, as an Integer value

      • startDialer

        public static void startDialer(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               long phoneNumber)
        Starts the dialer in order to call a specific phone number. If an error occurs while starting the dialer, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown. Calling this method requires the invoking app to have the permission android.Manifest.permission.CALL_PHONE, otherwise a SecurityException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the dialer should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        phoneNumber - The phone number, which should be called, as a Long value

      • startDialer

        public static void startDialer(@NonNull
                               android.app.Activity activity,
                               @NonNull
                               java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        Starts the dialer in order to call a specific phone number. If an error occurs while starting the dialer, an ActivityNotFoundException will be thrown. Calling this method requires the invoking app to have the permission android.Manifest.permission.CALL_PHONE, otherwise a SecurityException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity, the dialer should be started from, as an instance of the class Activity. The activity may not be null
        phoneNumber - The phone number, which should be called, as a String. The phone number may neither be null, nor empty
